noun.description: Alchemy. Impurity of a metal; †an instance of this, an impurity (obsolete). Compare "leprous". Now historical.
Botany. Scaliness (of a plant part). Compare leprose, "leprous". rare.

origin: Late Middle English; earliest use found in John Capgrave (1393–1464), prior of Bishop's Lynn, theologian, and historian. From post-classical Latin leprositat-, leprositas leprosy from leprosus + classical Latin -tās.
